snippet: A Moscow appeals court on Tuesday upheld a suspended three-and-a-half-year prison sentence against Aleksei A. Navalny, a leader of Russia’s opposition to President Vladimir V. Putin who was convicted last year of fraud in a case widely seen as...
abstract: Aleksei A Navalny, convicted in 2014 fraud case many view as politically motivated, has three-and-a-half-year suspended sentence upheld by Moscow appeals court; court also releases Navalny, Russian opposition leader, from house arrest.
lead_paragraph: A Moscow appeals court on Tuesday upheld a suspended three-and-a-half-year prison sentence against Aleksei A. Navalny, a leader of Russia’s opposition to President Vladimir V. Putin who was convicted last year of fraud in a case widely seen as politically motivated.

headline.main: Russia: Court Upholds Activist’s Suspended Sentence
headline.print_headline: Russia: Court Upholds Activist’s Suspended Sentence
